solidbase.util
Class BOMDetectingLineReader

java.lang.Object
  solidbase.util.BOMDetectingLineReader
All Implemented Interfaces:
LineReader
public class BOMDetectingLineReader
extends Object
implements LineReader

A line reader that automatically detects character encoding through the BOM and the first line.

Author:
René M. de Bloois

Field Summary

          The Byte Order Mark found at the beginning of the stream.

BOMDetectingLineReader

public BOMDetectingLineReader(BufferedInputStream in,
                              Pattern encodingDetection)
Creates a new line reader for the given input streamL.

Parameters:
in - The input stream to read lines from.
encodingDetection - A regular expression to detect the encoding on the first line.

readLine

public String readLine()
Reads a line from the stream. The line number count is incremented.

Specified by:
readLine in interface LineReader
Returns:
The line that is read or null of there are no more lines.

getLineNumber

public int getLineNumber()
Returns the current line number. The current line number is the line that is about to be read.

Specified by:
getLineNumber in interface LineReader
Returns:
The current line number.

getEncoding

public String getEncoding()
Returns the current character encoding of the stream.

Returns:
The current character encoding of the stream.

getBOM

public byte[] getBOM()
Returns the Byte Order Mark found in the stream.

Returns:
The Byte Order Mark found. Will be null if no BOM was present.
